Name: Honeysuckle Daiquiri
Ingredients: 60 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
20 ml Honey syrup (3 parts honey to 1 water by weight)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of mint leaf (or honeysuckle flower when in season).
Garnish with mint leaf floated on cocktail (or honeysuckle flower pegged to the rim).
Review: A Daiquiri made with flavoursome honey in place of sugar, or a Bee's Knees with rum in place of gin. However you view this, it's damn tasty.
History: Adapted from a recipe in David A. Embury's 1948 Fine Art of Mixing Drinks .
Nutrition: One serving of Honeysuckle Daiquiri contains 188 calories
